str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: Manner of life. From bioo; living.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From archomai; a commencement, or chief.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Youth, youthfulness. From neos; newness, i.e. Youthfulness.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
